info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 3:48PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Siskiyou County through 415 PM PDT... At 347 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Scott Bar, or 14 miles west of Yreka, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Klamath River and Scott Bar and in the vicinity of the McKinney Fire. This includes Highway 96 in California between mile markers 72 and 93. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
